subject: Economics
title: The Stag Hunt: Cooperation's Fragile Trust
description: A 60-second lesson on The Stag Hunt: Cooperation's Fragile Trust.

hook.text: Two hunters can catch a stag together or each catch a rabbit alone.

buildup.text: The stag hunt differs from the Prisoner's Dilemma: cooperation IS the best response to cooperation.

discovery.text: If you're not sure your partner will cooperate, the safe choice is the rabbit.

twist.text: Many real problems are stag hunts, not prisoner's dilemmas.

climax.text: The stag hunt reveals that the biggest barrier to cooperation isn't greed â€” it's fear.

punchline.text: We often settle for rabbits not because we don't want the stag.
